units.title: Pre‑coat plates with GFR Matrigel
units.text: Pre-coat 24-well plates with GFR Matrigel as described in Reagent setup. The coated plates can be wrapped in Paraﬁlm and kept for ≤2 weeks at 4 oC.
units.rationale: Establishes a sterile extracellular matrix for PSC attachment.

units.title: Remove mTeSR1 and wash wells
units.text: Take a six-well plate of undifferentiated PSCs and remove the mTeSR1 by aspiration from the wells to be passaged (Fig. 2a). Wash the wells with 2 ml of sterile DPBS. Aspirate the DPBS.
units.rationale: Prepares cells for enzymatic dissociation by eliminating existing medium.

units.title: Add accutase and incubate
units.text: Add 1 ml of accutase to the wells. Incubate at 37 oC for 5 min, allowing PSC colonies to dissociate into single cells.
units.rationale: Enzymatically detaches cells to obtain a single‑cell suspension.

units.title: Centrifuge cells
units.text: Centrifuge the cells at 1,000 r.p.m. for 3 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Pellets cells for medium exchange and downstream processing.

units.title: Plate cells with Y‑27632
units.text: Plate the cells at a density of 100,000–150,000 cells/well in 500 μl of mTeSR1 including 10 μM Y-27632 on a Matrigel-coated tissue culture 24-well plate. Prepare cells with at least two independent wells to generate anterior and posterior gut spheroids at the same time.
units.rationale: Seeds PSCs at optimal density while protecting them from dissociation stress.

units.title: Change mTeSR medium (day −1)
units.text: Aspirate old mTeSR1 with 10 μM Y-27632 to change the medium. Add fresh mTeSR1 without Y-27632 (Step 16), 500 μl/well for a 24-well plate.
units.rationale: Removes ROCK inhibitor and provides fresh growth medium for recovery.

units.title: Dissociate gut cells with TrypLE
units.text: On day 7, dissociate the anterior or posterior gut cells to single cells by incubation with TrypLE Express at 37 °C for 5 min (Fig. 3a).
units.rationale: Generates single‑cell suspensions required for spheroid re‑aggregation.

units.title: Form gut spheroids in ultra‑low attachment plates
units.text: Plate the anterior or posterior gut cell suspensions in 96-well round-bottom ultra-low attachment plates at a density of 10,000 cells with 100 µl day 7 medium per well and incubate at 37 °C overnight to form spheroids. Prepare the same number of anterior and posterior spheroids.
units.rationale: Allows self‑assembly of 3D spheroids in a non‑adherent environment.

units.title: Fuse anterior and posterior spheroids
units.text: On day 8, pick up one generated single posterior spheroid with entire medium in a well by using a mechanical pipette with a wide-bore 200-µl tip. Pipette up and down first so that the spheroid gets suspended in the medium. Transfer the posterior spheroid to a well containing one anterior spheroid in the same 96-well round-bottom ultra-low attachment plate (Fig. 3b). Centrifuge the plate at 1,000 r.p.m. for 1 min to gather spheroids and incubate at 37 °C for 24 h to form fused boundary spheroids (anterior-posterior gut spheroid; A-P spheroids).
units.rationale: Creates a boundary organoid by physically joining anterior and posterior spheroids.

units.title: Embed A‑P spheroids in Matrigel drops
units.text: Add 20–30 µl/well of 100% Matrigel (Phenol Red–Free) on ice to the fused A-P spheroid in a 1.5-ml tube. Gently re-suspend the single A-P spheroid by using a mechanical pipette with a wide-bore 200-µl tip and slowly plate it on a 24-well tissue culture plate (VWR International) to make a Matrigel drop. Incubate the drop in a CO2 incubator at 37 °C for 5 min. Flip the plate upside down and incubate for a further 5 min to prevent the spheroid from attaching to the bottom. Add enough gut growth medium to cover the entire drop and culture for 4 d to generate HBPOs.
units.rationale: Provides a 3‑D extracellular matrix for further differentiation and organoid maturation.
